meanings.sent1: Yesterday, I strook the ball with my foot.
meanings.sent2: She strook the nail with the hammer.
meanings.sent3: The cat strook the mouse playfully with its paw.
meanings.sent4: The storm strook the town with fierce winds.
meanings.sent5: He strook the keys on the piano with passion.

meanings.definition: A line or mark made by a stroke.
meanings.sent1: The artist drew a colorful strook on the canvas.
meanings.sent2: The teacher pointed to the red strook on the paper.
meanings.sent3: The child added a wavy strook to the drawing.
meanings.sent4: The sun painted the sky with a golden strook.
meanings.sent5: The rainbow appeared as a beautiful strook across the sky.

meanings.sent1: He felt a sharp strook on his shoulder.
meanings.sent2: The boxer delivered a powerful strook to his opponent.
meanings.sent3: The pillow fight ended with a gentle strook.
meanings.sent4: Her words felt like a painful strook to his heart.
meanings.sent5: The tree branch gave a surprising strook to his head.
